alert.note: Alert for Knox; Marshall; Stark (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 11:07PM CST until January 05 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blowing and drifting snow. Winds 20 to 30 mph gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Knox, Stark and Marshall Counties. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and some deep drifts possible as snow blows onto roadways. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Wind chill temperatures as low as 15 degrees below zero will be possible Wednesday morning, and could cause frostbite on exposed skin in 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the Internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com
